current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To protect and enhance opportunities for recreational hunting, fishing, and shooting, and for other
			 purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read the first time

action-desc.#text: Read the second time and placed on the calendar
Read the second time and placed on the calendar

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.

Sec. 102. Modification of definition of sport fishing equipment under the Toxic Substances Control
			 Act.
Sec. 105. Permits for importation of polar bear trophies taken in sport hunts in Canada.
Sec. 106. Baiting of migratory game birds.
Sec. 107. Recreational fishing, hunting, and recreational shooting on Federal public land.
Sec. 108. Annual permit and fee for film crews of 5 persons or fewer.
Sec. 201. Availability of Land and Water Conservation Fund for recreational public access projects.
Sec. 202. Federal Land Transaction Facilitation Act.
Sec. 203. North American Wetlands Conservation Act.
Sec. 204. National Fish and Wildlife Foundation Establishment Act.

in recent years preceding the date of enactment of this Act, portions of Federal land have been

providing opportunities for target practice and marksmanship training at public target ranges on

to promote enjoyment of shooting, recreational, and hunting activities; and
to ensure safe and convenient locations for those activities;

header.#text:
Recreational
			 fishing, hunting, and recreational shooting

text.#text:
Subject to valid existing rights, and in cooperation with
			 the respective State fish and wildlife agency, a Federal public land
			 management official shall exercise the authority of the official under
			 existing
			 law (including provisions regarding land use planning) to facilitate use
			 of and
			 access to Federal public land for recreational fishing, hunting, and
			 recreational shooting except as limited by—

any other Federal
			 law (including regulations) that precludes recreational fishing, hunting,
			 or recreational shooting on
			 specific Federal public land units of Federal public land, or water;
			 or

discretionary
			 limitations on recreational fishing, hunting, and recreational shooting
			 determined to be necessary and reasonable, as	supported by the best
			 scientific
			 evidence and advanced through a transparent public process.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the head of each Federal public land management agency
			 shall exercise the land management discretion of the head—

Consistent
			 with

to the extent

in accordance
			 with applicable Federal law.

			 (including land resources management plans, resource management plans,
			 travel
			 management plans, and energy development plans) shall include a specific
			 evaluation of the effects of the plans on opportunities to engage in
			 recreational fishing, hunting, or recreational shooting.
